techs.name: Foraging
techs.quote: 'A foraging wild creature, intent above all upon survival, is as strong as the grass.' - Richard Adams

techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster

techs.name: Stone Tools
techs.quote: 'I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'He who commands the sea has command of everything.' - Themistocles

techs.name: Pottery
techs.quote: 'Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, what makest thou?' - Bible Isaiah 45:9

techs.name: Animal Husbandry
techs.quote: 'Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.' - Bible Deuteronomy 25:4

techs.name: Archery
uniques: [+33]% weight to this choice for AI decisions <for [Macedonia] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'The haft of the arrow has been feathered with one of the eagle's own plumes, we often give our enemies the means of our own destruction' - Aesop

techs.name: Mining
uniques: [+100]% weight to this choice for AI decisions <for [Macedonia] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.' - J. Paul Getty

techs.name: Optics
techs.quote: 'He made an instrument to know if the moon shine at full or no.' - Samuel Butler

techs.name: Calendar
techs.quote: 'So teach us to number our days, so that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.' - Bible Psalms 90:12

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Trapping
techs.quote: 'Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.' - Saint Jerome

techs.name: The Wheel
techs.quote: 'Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.' - Japanese proverb

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Bronze Working
uniques: [+200]% weight to this choice for AI decisions <for [Macedonia] Civilizations> <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.' - Homer

techs.name: Fermentation
techs.quote: 'There in wine is found the great generalization: all life is fermentation.' - Richard Feynman

techs.name: Spirituality
techs.quote: 'The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious – the fundamental - emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Horseback Riding
techs.quote: 'A Horse! A Horse! My kingdom for a horse!' - Shakespeare (Richard III)

techs.name: Mathematics
techs.quote: 'Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'Three things are to be looked to in a building: that it stands on the right spot; that it be securely founded; that it be successfully executed.' - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

techs.name: Shipbuilding
techs.quote: 'There is nothing but a plank between a sailor and eternity.' - Thomas Gibbons

techs.name: Drama and Poetry
techs.quote: 'What is drama but life with the dull bits cut out.' - Alfred Hitchcock

techs.name: Philosophy
techs.quote: 'There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.' - Socrates

techs.name: Imperial Games
techs.quote: 'The People who once upon a time handed out military command, high civil office, legions — everything, now restrains itself and anxiously hopes for just two things: bread and circuses.' - Juvenal

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'Better is bread with a happy heart than wealth with vexation.' - Amenemope

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'Instrumental or mechanical science is the noblest and, above all others, the most useful.' - Leonardo da Vinci

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: 'Do not wait to strike til the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.' - William Butler Yeats

techs.name: Compass
techs.quote: 'I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving.' - Oliver Wendell Holmes

techs.name: Theology
techs.quote: 'Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do' - St. Thomas Aquinas

techs.name: Civil Service
techs.quote: 'The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is its inefficiency' - Eugene McCarthy

techs.name: Guilds
techs.quote: 'The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained...' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Military Tactics
uniques: Comment [+10% Strength to Military units adjacent to another Military unit]
[{non-air} {Military}] units gain the [Formation I] promotion <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'Tactics mean doing what you can with what you have.' - Saul Alinsky

techs.name: Metal Casting
techs.quote: 'When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established.' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Education
uniques: Allied City-States provide [Science] equal to [50]% of what they produce for themselves
techs.quote: 'Education is the best provision for old age.' - Aristotle

techs.name: Distillation
techs.quote: 'Whoever drinks beer, he is quick to sleep; whoever sleeps long, does not sin; whoever does not sin, enters Heaven! Thus, let us drink beer!' - Martin Luther

techs.name: Chivalry
techs.quote: 'Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone and anvil, is rightwise king born of all England.' - Malory

techs.name: Machinery
techs.quote: 'The press is the best instrument for enlightening the mind of man, and improving him as a rational, moral and social being.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Physics
techs.quote: 'Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.' - Galileo Galilei

techs.name: Steel
techs.quote: 'John Henry said to his Captain, / 'A man ain't nothin' but a man, / And before I'll let your steam drill beat me down, / I'll die with the hammer in my hand.'' - Anonymous: The Ballad of John Henry, the Steel-Drivin' Man

techs.name: Astronomy
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: 'Joyfully to the breeze royal Odysseus spread his sail, and with his rudder skillfully he steered.' - Homer

techs.name: Acoustics
techs.quote: 'Their rising all at once was as the sound of thunder heard remote' - Milton

techs.name: Mechanics
techs.quote: 'When you want to know how things really work, study them when they're coming apart.' - William Gibson

techs.name: Banking
techs.quote: 'Happiness: a good bank account, a good cook and a good digestion' - Jean Jacques Rousseau

techs.name: Printing Press
techs.quote: 'It is a newspaper's duty to print the news and raise hell.' - The Chicago Times

techs.name: Gunpowder
techs.quote: 'The day when two army corps can annihilate each other in one second, all civilized nations, it is to be hoped, will recoil from war and discharge their troops.' - Alfred Nobel

techs.name: Navigation
techs.quote: 'The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.' - Edward Gibbon

techs.name: Architecture
techs.quote: 'Architecture begins where engineering ends.' - Walter Gropius

techs.name: Economics
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]
techs.quote: 'Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Metallurgy
techs.quote: 'There never was a good knife made of bad steel.' - Benjamin Franklin

techs.name: Siege Tactics
techs.quote: 'The lowest is to attack a city. Siege of a city is only done as a last resort.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Chemistry
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Science]
techs.quote: 'Wherever we look, the work of the chemist has raised the level of our civilization and has increased the productive capacity of the nation.' - Calvin Coolidge

techs.name: Archaeology
techs.quote: 'Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.' - George Santayana

techs.name: Scientific Theory
techs.quote: 'Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.' - John Dewey

techs.name: Urban Planning
uniques: Comment [+10% Production when constructing pre-industrial buildings in all cities]
[+10]% Production when constructing [Prehistoric era] buildings [in all cities] <hidden from users>
[+10]% Production when constructing [Ancient era] buildings [in all cities] <hidden from users>
[+10]% Production when constructing [Classical era] buildings [in all cities] <hidden from users>
[+10]% Production when constructing [Medieval era] buildings [in all cities] <hidden from users>
[+10]% Production when constructing [Renaissance era] buildings [in all cities] <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.' - Douglas Adams

techs.name: Industrialization
techs.quote: 'Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.' - Emily Greene Balch

techs.name: Rifling
techs.quote: 'It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it.' - Robert E. Lee

techs.name: Military Science
techs.quote: 'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.' - George S. Patton

techs.name: Fertilizer
techs.quote: 'The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself.' - Franklin Delano Roosevelt

techs.name: Biology
uniques: Comment [Military units heal +5 HP when healing with an additional +5 HP when adjacent to another Military unit]
[{non-air} {Military}] units gain the [Medic] promotion <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'If the brain were so simple we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.' - Lyall Watson

techs.name: Electricity
techs.quote: 'Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?' - Nathaniel Hawthorne

techs.name: Refining
techs.quote: 'Engineering is the art of directing the great sources of power in nature for the use and convenience of man.' - Thomas Tredgold

techs.name: Steam Power
techs.quote: 'The nations of the West hope that by means of steam communication all the world will become as one family.' - Townsend Harris

techs.name: Dynamite
techs.quote: 'As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.' - Christopher Dawson

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: 'And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.' - William Wordsworth

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.' - Woody Allen

techs.name: Financial Capital
uniques: Comment [+2 [Gold] for every Luxury resource you own]
[Gold] cost of purchasing items in cities [-10]%
techs.quote: 'If you’re in the luckiest one per cent of humanity, you owe it to the rest of humanity to think about the other ninetynine per cent.' - Warren Buffett

techs.name: Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: 'Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.' - Henry Ford

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Combustion
uniques: Religion naturally spreads to cities [+3] tiles away
techs.quote: 'Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: 'Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.' - Buck Henry and Calder Willingham, The Graduate

techs.name: Sociology
uniques: [+8 Culture, +8 Science] <in cities with at least [4] [Specialists]>
techs.quote: 'The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to change it.' - Karl Marx

techs.name: Electronics
techs.quote: 'There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time.' - Trip Hawkins

techs.name: Cultural Hegemony
uniques: Resting point for Influence with City-States is increased by [30]
Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [15]% less than normal
Each city founded increases Science cost of Technologies [15]% less than normal
techs.quote: 'Ideas and opinions are not spontaneously born in each individual brain: they have had a centre of formation, or irradiation, of dissemination, of persuasion-a group of men, or a single individual even, which has developed them and presented them in the political form of current reality.' - Antonio Gramsci

techs.name: Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Men, like bullets, go farthest when they are smoothest.' - Jean Paul

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: 'The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.' - Ludwig von Mises

techs.name: Pharmaceuticals
techs.quote: 'In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.' - Cicero

techs.name: Atomic Theory
uniques: Comment [Resting points with City-States will raise by triple the Strength level of each of the nuclear devices in your possession]
techs.quote: 'The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking, and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophes.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Radar
techs.quote: 'Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.' - Jonathan Swift

techs.name: Information Theory
techs.quote: 'An individual tends to absorb the surrounding spirit and to radiate the acquired lifestyle and worldview to anyone around, not just to a select friend.' - Andrej Kolmogorov

techs.name: Advanced Espionage
techs.quote: 'In art and dream may you proceed with abandon. In life may you proceed with balance and stealth.' - Patti Smith

techs.name: Ecology
uniques: [+100]% weight to this choice for AI decisions <hidden from users>
techs.quote: 'Only within the moment of time represented by the present century has one species, man, acquired significant power to alter the nature of his world.' - Rachel Carson

techs.name: Environmentalism
techs.quote: 'What we are doing to the forests of the world is but a mirror reflection of what we are doing to ourselves.' - Mahatma Gandhi

techs.name: Nuclear Fission
techs.quote: 'I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.' - J. Robert Oppenheimer

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: 'A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.' - Astronautics Magazine, 1937

techs.name: Cybernetics
uniques: [+1 Science] from every specialist [in all cities]
techs.quote: 'The boundary between man and machine is not a wall, but a membrane.' - Norbert Wiener

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: 'Computers are like Old Testament gods: lots of rules and no mercy.' - Joseph Campbell

techs.name: Telecommunications
techs.quote: 'The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.' - J.B. Priestly

techs.name: Mobile Tactics
techs.quote: 'All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Advanced Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power, we have guided missiles and misguided men.' – Martin Luther King Jr.

techs.name: Satellites
techs.quote: 'Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien.' - Lyndon B. Johnson

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: '1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.' - Isaac Asimov

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: 'The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.' - The Holy Bible: Romans, 13:12

techs.name: Globalization
uniques: Gifts of Gold to City-States generate [25]% more Influence
techs.quote: 'Globalization is not a monolith; it's a complex of flows—some smooth, some turbulent.' - Arjun Appadurai

techs.name: Particle Physics
techs.quote: 'Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.' - Isaac Newton

techs.name: Nanotechnology
techs.quote: 'The impact of nanotechnology is expected to exceed the impact that the electronics revolution has had on our lives.' - Richard Schwartz

techs.name: Stealth
techs.quote: 'Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness, be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Nuclear Fusion
techs.quote: 'The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has readily made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Advanced AI
techs.quote: 'Will no entreaties cause thee to turn a favourable eye upon thy creature, who implores thy goodness and compassion?' - Mary Shelley

techs.name: Future Tech
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

civilopediaText.text: Who knows what the future holds?
